concept.title: LTPA validation fails
concept.shortdesc: There are several common reasons why LTPA validation might fail.

section.title: Does the LTPA profile have a valid LTPA key file?
section.p: The LTPA profile must have a valid LTPA key file from or . To resolve the problem, ensure that the LTPA key file is valid, and is associated with the correct LTPA profile.

section.title: Is the LTPA profile associated with the correct security profile?
section.p: The LTPA profile must be assigned to a security profile, and the security profile must be associated with the endpoint that the client application is connecting to. If the LTPA profile is not associated with the correct security profile and endpoint, the LTPA authentication fails. To resolve the problem, ensure that the LTPA profile is associated with the correct security profile and endpoint.

section.title: Is the expiration time of the token valid?
section.p: If the token expiration time is invalid, the LTPA authentication fails. If the application is connected to when the token expires, the connection to ends.

section.title: Is the user name and password correct?
section.p: The client application must have a user name of IMA_LTPA_AUTH and a password that is set to the LTPA token value. If the user name and password are not correct, the LTPA authentication fails. To resolve the problem, ensure that the user name and password are correctly set.
